title: Alan Shearer names his surprise  favourite  to win the FA Cup
body_text:
Alan Shearer has named his surprise ‘favourite’ to win the FA Cup ahead of Premier League champions Manchester City.
Eight teams remain in football’s oldest cup competition following an intriguing and entertaining round of fixtures in the fifth round.
Man City ended Plymouth Argyle’s dream FA Cup run which included a famous victory over current Premier League leaders Liverpool.
Pep Guardiola’s side, already out of the title race and the Champions League following a surprising poor run, will face high-flying Bournemouth for a place in the semi-finals.
Bournemouth have emerged as surprise top-four contenders this season and beat Wolves on penalties to set up a quarter-final tie against Manchester City.
One London club will be in the hat for the semi-finals as Fulham prepare to host Crystal Palace in the quarters, with the former knocking out Manchester United and the latter overcoming Championship side Millwall.
Champions League club Aston Villa travel to Championship outfit Preston, who thumped Lancashire rivals Burnley 3-0 to continue a memorable FA Cup run.

The final quarter-final tie sees Brighton take on Nottingham Forest, who beat Ipswich Town on penalties in the last fifth-round clash.
With the likes of Liverpool, Arsenal and Chelsea out, seven-time winners Manchester City have a superb chance to finish a difficult season with another FA Cup trophy, but Shearer believes Aston Villa are in fact ‘favourites’ to win the competition.
Speaking on The Rest is Football podcast, the ex-England striker said: ‘Aston Villa have got really good attacking options, Unai Emery can swap them around like he has done.

‘I would perhaps have Aston Villa as favourites for this competition now. If they can get one or two defenders back from the treatment room then they will be hard to beat.
‘I know it’s away from home but their draw against Preston, they can’t really complain about that. I quite fancy Aston Villa. They could have an unbelievable season, one to really remember.
‘They’re going well in the Champions League and are close to that top-four in the Premier League. If they can just get one or two players back it could be a great finish to the season because those January signings have served them well and will do for the rest of the season.’
Responding to Shearer’s surprising FA Cup claim, former Premier League defender Micah Richards added: ‘I totally agree.
‘I think Unai Emery is a genius. Tactically he knows exactly what he wants. It was a masterstroke getting in that calibre of players in January.
‘They’ve got quality all over. He’s doing a brilliant job, it could be a remarkable season for Aston Villa.

‘I will still go with Man City just because of their experience. In a one-off game they can still produce something special so I will go with Man City, just.’
Gary Lineker, meanwhile, is backing Bournemouth to produce a stunning FA Cup win following their progress under the impressive Andoni Iraola.
‘I think Man City are most likely but I’m going to pluck out Bournemouth,’ Lineker said.
‘There’s one for you! I like Areola, I think he’s got something, and they’ve already beaten Man City this season. We shall see.’
